description: From Middle English biclarten, equivalent to be- +‎ clart. Cognate with Scots beclairt (“to soil, splash or cover with filth”).

verbs.description: beclart (third-person singular simple present beclarts, present participle beclarting, simple past and past participle beclarted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal) To besmear; bedaub; bemire; smear all over with dirt.
